p:
Ibrutinib, acalabrutinib, and venetoclax prolong progression-free and overall survival with lower risk of infections and similar/lower need for hospital care when compared to chemo(immuno)therapy.
43– 46, 54, 56, 58, 59 The percentage of opportunistic infections reported for ibrutinib is low (4.1%) and similar to that reported for venetoclax (3.1%).
79– 82 Compared to chemo(immuno)therapy, ibrutinib and acalabrutinib do not produce lymphopenia, a known risk factor for severe COVID-19.
79, 83– 85 The incidence of any ≥3 grade adverse events does not differ between ibrutinib (41%–77%), acalabrutinib (50%), and venetoclax (78%), indicating that the frequency of unplanned visits for adverse event management is likely to be similar for the 3 drugs.
43– 45, 54, 56, 58 Venetoclax may require additional unplanned visits for tumor lysis management during the ramp up phase.
